head.title: HomeLend Mortgage Offer – ~20 pages with long section

styles.content:
<style>
:root{
  --header-h:15mm; --footer-h:10mm;
  --page-width:210mm; --page-height:297mm;
  --muted:#6b7280; --accent:#0b5fff;
}
*{ box-sizing:border-box; }
html, body{ margin:0; padding:0; background:#fff; }
body{ font-family: Inter, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color:#111; }
.page{ width:var(--page-width); height:var(--page-height); position:relative; background:#fff; page-break-after:always; }
.page:last-child{ page-break-after:auto; }
.hdr{ height:var(--header-h); padding:6px 10mm; display:flex; align-items:center; gap:10px; border-bottom:2px solid #e5e7eb; background:linear-gradient(90deg,#f4f7ff,#fff); }
.hdr svg{ height:calc(var(--header-h) - 8px); width:auto; }
.ftr{ height:var(--footer-h); border-top:1px solid #e5e7eb; display:flex; align-items:center; justify-content:space-between; padding:0 10mm; color:var(--muted); font-size:11px; }
.body{ position:absolute; top:var(--header-h); bottom:var(--footer-h); left:0; right:0; padding:10mm; overflow:hidden; }
.flow > * { break-inside: avoid; }

h1{ font-size:22px; margin:0 0 6px 0; letter-spacing:.02em; }
h2{ font-size:18px; margin:10px 0 6px 0; }
p{ line-height:1.45; margin:0 0 6px 0; }
.badge{ display:inline-block; background:var(--accent); color:#fff; padding:.2rem .5rem; border-radius:999px; font-size:12px; }
.note{ color:var(--muted); font-size:12px; }
.kv{ width:100%; border-collapse:collapse; font-size:13px; margin:6px 0; }
.kv th, .kv td{ border:1px solid #e5e7eb; padding:6px 8px; text-align:left; vertical-align:top; }
.kv th{ background:#f7f9ff; width:36%; }
.table{ width:100%; border-collapse:collapse; font-size:13px; margin:6px 0; }
.table th, .table td{ border:1px solid #e5e7eb; padding:6px 8px; vertical-align:top; }
.table thead th{ background:#f7f9ff; }
.money{ font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums; text-align:right; }
.forcePageEnd{ page-break-after:always; break-after:page; height:1px; background:transparent; }
.warning{ border-left:4px solid #ea580c; padding:8px 10px; background:#fff7ed; }
.info{ border-left:4px solid var(--accent); padding:8px 10px; background:#f5f8ff; }
.checklist{ columns:2; column-gap:16px; }
@page{ size:210mm 297mm; margin:0; }
</style>

Mortgage Offer – Cover

Offer ID: MORT-2025-52445 • Offer Date: 12 Sep 2025 • Offer Expires: 12 Oct 2025

LenderHomeLend Bank plc
Borrower(s)Priya Shah & Daniel Baker
Property14 Willow Grove, Cambridge, CB1 2AB
Loan Amount£372,000.00
Purchase Price / Value£465,000.00
Loan to Value (LTV)80.0%
Summary: 5-year fixed rate then reverts to SVR, 30-year capital & interest repayment. Buildings insurance required prior to completion.

Borrower Details

NamesPriya Shah (DOB 12/03/1993); Daniel Baker (DOB 22/11/1991)
Current AddressFlat 5, 8 Rowan Street, Cambridge, CB2 1YZ
ResidencyUK Residents • Indefinite leave to remain
EmploymentPriya: Software Engineer (Perm); Daniel: Teacher (Perm)
Income£74,000 + £5,000 bonus; £41,500
Credit ConductNo adverse in last 6 years

This offer is subject to ongoing verification until completion.

Property Details

Address14 Willow Grove, Cambridge, CB1 2AB
TenureFreehold
ConstructionBrick and tile, standard construction
ValuationMortgage Valuation at £465,000.00 (satisfactory)
OccupancyMain residential home
Special Condition: Retention of £2,000 until damp-proof course repairs are evidenced post-completion.

Loan Summary

Product5-Year Fixed (to 31 Oct 2030) then HLB Standard Variable Rate
Loan Amount£372,000.00
Term30 years (360 months)
Interest Rate5.19% fixed for 60 months
APRC5.3%
Repayment TypeCapital & Interest
Estimated Monthly Payment (fixed period)£2,040.40

Amortisation Snapshot (Year 1)

Figures are illustrative and may vary slightly on completion.

Product Features

  • Fixed rate for first 60 months.
  • Reversion to Standard Variable Rate thereafter.
  • Up to 10% overpayment of starting balance per year without charge during fixed period.
  • Porting available, subject to lending criteria at the time.
  • Payment holiday may be available after 12 months subject to affordability.
If you move or remortgage during the fixed period, Early Repayment Charges may apply (see ERC table).

Fees & Costs

DescriptionAmountPayable
Product Fee£999.00Added to loan
Valuation Fee£350.00Upfront
Solicitor (estimate)£850.00On completion
Funds Transfer£35.00On completion

Third-party fees are indicative and may change.

Funds Disbursement

Gross Loan£372,999.00 (incl. product fee)
Less Retention£2,000.00
Net Advance£370,999.00
PayeeYour solicitor's client account

Your solicitor will settle any apportionments, stamp duty (if applicable), and their fees from your funds.

Direct Debit Mandate

Payments will be collected monthly on the 1st. You may choose any date from the 1st to the 28th.

Account NamePriya Shah
Sort Code04-00-04
Account Number12345678

We are a member of the Direct Debit Guarantee.

Early Repayment Charges (ERC)

During Fixed PeriodCharge
Year 15% of amount repaid early
Year 24% of amount repaid early
Year 33% of amount repaid early
Year 42% of amount repaid early
Year 51% of amount repaid early

No ERC after fixed period ends. Overpayments within 10% allowance are not charged.

Overpayments & Payment Holidays

You may overpay up to 10% of the opening balance each year without charge during the fixed period.

Overpaying will reduce your term or payment, depending on your choice at the time of overpayment.

Payment holidays may be available after 12 consecutive on-time payments and are subject to affordability checks.

Insurance Requirements

Buildings insurance for the full reinstatement value must be in place from exchange of contracts.

Life and income protection insurance are recommended but not mandatory.

If the property is leasehold, ensure ground rent and service charges are covered in your budgeting.

Valuation & Surveys

We have instructed a mortgage valuation to confirm suitability as security. This is not a structural survey.

You are advised to obtain your own RICS HomeBuyer or Building Survey for a comprehensive assessment.

Special Conditions

  1. Retention of £2,000 until damp-proof works are certified by a qualified contractor.
  2. Provide evidence of buildings insurance naming HomeLend Bank plc as interested party.
  3. Assignment of any new-build warranty or guarantees where applicable.

Solicitor Instructions

Your solicitor must:

  • Confirm good and marketable title and report any material issues.
  • Check planning/building regulation consents and restrictive covenants.
  • Obtain searches and satisfy lender handbook requirements.
  • Register the charge at HM Land Registry.

Regulatory Disclosures

This mortgage is regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority.

APRC5.3%
Total Amount PayableShown in your ESIS illustration and includes interest over the term.
Variable Rate RiskPayments may increase after the fixed period if rates rise.

Complaints & Redress

Contact: complaints@homelend.co.uk • 0800 123 4455

If you are not satisfied, you may refer to the Financial Ombudsman Service.

Glossary

TermMeaning
APRCAnnual Percentage Rate of Charge, a total cost of borrowing measure.
ERCEarly Repayment Charge, fee for repaying during a tie-in period.
LTVLoan to Value ratio (Loan ÷ Property Value).
SVRStandard Variable Rate set by the lender after introductory period.

<script>
// Paginates each .page body (between fixed header/footer), honors .forcePageEnd,
// and writes page numbers after splitting.
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
  const BUFFER = 2;
  function ensureFlow(page){
    const body = page.querySelector('.body');
    let flow = body.querySelector(':scope > .flow');
    if(!flow){
      flow = document.createElement('div');
      flow.className = 'flow';
      const kids = Array.from(body.childNodes);
      body.innerHTML='';
      kids.forEach(k => flow.appendChild(k));
      body.appendChild(flow);
    }
    return { body, flow };
  }
  function makePageAfter(prevPage){
    const clone = prevPage.cloneNode(true);
    const cBody = clone.querySelector('.body');
    cBody.innerHTML='';
    const cFlow = document.createElement('div');
    cFlow.className = 'flow';
    cBody.appendChild(cFlow);
    prevPage.parentNode.insertBefore(clone, prevPage.nextSibling);
    return { page: clone, body: cBody, flow: cFlow };
  }
  function paginate(page){
    const { body, flow } = ensureFlow(page);
    const items = Array.from(flow.children);
    flow.innerHTML='';
    let cur = { page, body, flow };
    for(const el of items){
      if(el.classList && el.classList.contains('forcePageEnd')){
        if(cur.flow.childElementCount > 0){ cur = makePageAfter(cur.page); }
        continue;
      }
      cur.flow.appendChild(el);
      const elBottom = el.getBoundingClientRect().bottom;
      const bodyBottom = cur.body.getBoundingClientRect().bottom;
      if(elBottom > bodyBottom - BUFFER){
        cur.flow.removeChild(el);
        const next = makePageAfter(cur.page);
        next.flow.appendChild(el);
        cur = next;
      }
    }
  }
  const originals = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.page'));
  originals.forEach(pg => paginate(pg));

  const pages = Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('.page'));
  const total = pages.length;
  pages.forEach((pg, i) => {
    pg.querySelectorAll('.current').forEach(el => el.textContent = String(i+1));
    pg.querySelectorAll('.total').forEach(el => el.textContent = String(total));
  });
});
</script>
